layer.name: Skill
layer.definition: Get measurably better at what matters.

questions.text: My ability to navigate morally complex situations is ...

answers.4: solid — I can usually find wisdom in difficult territory
answers.5: strong — I navigate complexity with discernment and confidence
answers.2: weak — I can handle simple cases but get lost in complexity
answers.3: developing — I manage some situations well, others poorly
answers.1: poor — I freeze or stumble in grey areas

questions.text: My ability to anticipate moral pitfalls before I'm in them is ...

answers.4: good — I usually see the setup before the spring
answers.5: sharp — I've learned to spot danger early and steer clear
answers.2: weak — I occasionally notice danger but often too late
answers.3: inconsistent — I catch some traps, walk into others
answers.1: absent — I usually don't see it coming

questions.text: My ability to explain the 'why' behind moral principles is ...

answers.4: solid — I can articulate why things matter, not just that they do
answers.5: strong — I understand and can explain the architecture of morality
answers.2: basic — I can explain simple cases but not deeper logic
answers.3: developing — I understand some principles deeply, others surface-level
answers.1: poor — I know rules but not reasons

questions.text: My practical wisdom about making restitution when I've wronged someone is ...

answers.4: good — I know how to make things right in most cases
answers.5: strong — I've learned what actually heals and I practice it
answers.2: basic — I apologize but don't know what actually heals
answers.3: developing — I sometimes restore well, sometimes make it worse
answers.1: nonexistent — I don't know how to repair what I've broken

questions.text: My ability to counsel others through moral dilemmas is ...

answers.4: solid — I can walk people through complexity effectively
answers.5: strong — I can help others find wisdom they couldn't find alone
answers.2: basic — I can offer opinions but not real guidance
answers.3: developing — I help sometimes, other times I'm in over my head
answers.1: absent — I can barely navigate my own dilemmas
